title: Brooklyn Developer Yoel Goldman’s All Year Files for Bankruptcy to Continue $1.56 Billion Debt Talks
sub_head: Real-estate company says a recovery in New York City market isn’t enough to help satisfy debt obligations
body:
Brooklyn property developer Yoel Goldman’s All Year Holdings Ltd. filed for bankruptcy Tuesday to protect itself from potential litigation in the U.S. and Israel while continuing negotiations with creditors over $1.56 billion in debt.
All Year has been in restructuring talks with bondholders since April and looking for investors to either recapitalize or outright buy its property business, according to papers filed in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Manhattan.
